recommended_movies: Anchorman: The Legend of Ron Burgundy (2004)

simulated_ratings.title: The Devil's Rejects (2005)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Grimy road-trip carnage and a ruthless pursuit gave me the mean streak I like.

simulated_ratings.title: The Hills Have Eyes (2006)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Savage mutant-family siege in the wasteland hit my brutal survival-horror sweet spot.

simulated_ratings.title: High Tension (2003)
simulated_ratings.feeling: A relentless farmhouse nightmare that keeps the tension and blood pumping.

simulated_ratings.title: Martyrs (2008)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Unflinching revenge and depravity impressed me, even if the despair lingers.

simulated_ratings.title: The Descent (2005)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Claustrophobic cave terror and creature chaos made for a vicious, nerve-shredding ride.

simulated_ratings.title: Inside (2007)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Single-minded home-invasion ferocity delivered the nasty punch I crave.

simulated_ratings.title: Eden Lake (2008)
simulated_ratings.feeling: A cruel escalation from rowdy to ruthless left me shaken in a good way.

simulated_ratings.title: The Collector (2009)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Booby-trapped house-of-horrors scratches the Saw itch with tight, nasty thrills.

simulated_ratings.title: The Collection (2012)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Bigger, booby-trapped mayhem is fun, if less tense than the first.

simulated_ratings.title: Wolf Creek (2005)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Outback captivity and brutality felt grimy and real, though it takes its time.

simulated_ratings.title: Don't Breathe (2016)
simulated_ratings.feeling: A break-in gone wrong piles on reversals and dread with satisfying nastiness.

simulated_ratings.title: [REC] (2007)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Locked-in found-footage terror escalates hard and keeps the dread raw.

simulated_ratings.title: Grave Encounters (2011)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Asylum found-footage haunts deliver some jolts but don’t all stick.

simulated_ratings.title: The Poughkeepsie Tapes (2007)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Serial-killer tapes and faux-investigation are disturbingly effective and right up my alley.

simulated_ratings.title: The Texas Chainsaw Massacre (2003)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Grimy family nightmare and relentless pursuit scratch the classic slasher itch.

simulated_ratings.title: The Cabin in the Woods (2012)
simulated_ratings.feeling: The meta cliche-poking setup felt too cute and undercut the menace for me.

simulated_ratings.title: Wrong Turn (2003)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Backwoods cannibal chase is generic but delivers enough grisly fun.

simulated_ratings.title: Step Brothers (2008)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Stupid-but-committed man-child chaos gave me solid laughs without wearing out.

simulated_ratings.title: Anchorman: The Legend of Ron Burgundy (2004)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Goofy newsroom antics land in patches—more smirk than belly-laugh for me.

simulated_ratings.title: Tropic Thunder (2008)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Big, loud shoot-and-spoof energy works well enough with a few sharp hits.

simulated_ratings.title: Pineapple Express (2008)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Stoner-on-the-run antics are hit-or-miss but the buddy chaos keeps it moving.

simulated_ratings.title: The Hangover (2009)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Broad, chaotic bachelor-night fallout is fun if pretty disposable.

simulated_ratings.title: Zombieland (2009)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Quippy apocalypse with crunchy zombie action balances laughs and gore nicely.

simulated_ratings.title: Tucker and Dale vs. Evil (2010)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Role-reversal hillbilly hijinks are clever and gory, though the joke repeats.

simulated_ratings.title: 22 Jump Street (2014)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Sequel leans hard on self-referential gags that wear thin despite some laughs.

simulated_ratings.title: Horrible Bosses (2011)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Murder-plot office chaos hits a sweet spot of nasty humor and momentum.

simulated_ratings.title: Bad Santa (2003)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Mean-spirited holiday grime and bleak laughs mostly work for me.

recommended_movies: Henry: Portrait of a Serial Killer (1986)
The Last House on the Left (2009)

simulated_ratings.title: I Saw the Devil (2010)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Vicious cat-and-mouse revenge with escalating cruelty is exactly the mean streak I enjoy.

simulated_ratings.title: The Loved Ones (2009)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Slick relationship comedy leaves me completely uninterested and unmoved.

simulated_ratings.title: The Strangers (2008)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Spare, relentless home-invasion dread and masked menace gnawed at me the whole time.

simulated_ratings.title: Hush (2016)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Lean, nasty cat-and-mouse in a secluded house keeps the tension tight and mean.

simulated_ratings.title: Incident in a Ghostland (2018)
simulated_ratings.feeling: A making-of doc when I want raw horror is just empty calories for me.

simulated_ratings.title: Frontier(s) (2007)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Grimy neo-Nazi hellhouse and escalating savagery scratch my hardcore siege-horror itch.

simulated_ratings.title: Kidnapped (2010)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Unflinching, suffocating home-invasion cruelty that doesn’t let up is right in my wheelhouse.

simulated_ratings.title: Ils (2006)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Stripped-down nocturnal terror works well even without the gore I usually crave.

simulated_ratings.title: Hounds of Love (2016)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Claustrophobic captivity and toxic couple psychology made this grim and gripping.

simulated_ratings.title: The Sadness (2021)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Taboo-smashing outbreak carnage and mean-spirited chaos hit my extreme-horror sweet spot.

simulated_ratings.title: Terrifier (2016)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Grab-bag ghost-video compilation has a few jolts but mostly feels like filler between bumps.

simulated_ratings.title: Maniac (2012)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Sleazy, intimate killer POV with scalp-tingling brutality left a satisfying grime.

simulated_ratings.title: Henry: Portrait of a Serial Killer (1986)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Cold, matter-of-fact violence and dead-eyed amorality linger in the worst way.

simulated_ratings.title: Sinister (2012)
simulated_ratings.feeling: The snuff-home-movie dread is potent even if the supernatural angle softens the blow a bit.

simulated_ratings.title: The Autopsy of Jane Doe (2016)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Tight, claustrophobic morgue mystery that steadily ratchets dread and payoff.

simulated_ratings.title: [REC] 2 (2009)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Louder, faster continuation still delivers panicked infection chaos I can get behind.

simulated_ratings.title: Hell House LLC (2015)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Faux-doc haunt setup builds credible dread and sticks the landing with nasty imagery.

simulated_ratings.title: Noroi: The Curse (2005)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Slow-burn faux-doc occult web seeps under the skin and culminates disturbingly.

simulated_ratings.title: Vacancy (2007)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Lean snuff-motel thriller feeds my home-invasion paranoia with satisfying nastiness.

simulated_ratings.title: Frozen (2010)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Simple survival setup with a few gnarly beats works well enough without needing much gore.

simulated_ratings.title: Wrong Turn 2: Dead End (2007)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Crunchy backwoods carnage hits the spot even if the reality-show shtick is goofy.

simulated_ratings.title: Evil Dead (2013)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Unrelenting practical gore and demonic ferocity are pure catnip for me.

simulated_ratings.title: Dawn of the Dead (2004)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Propulsive mall-siege mayhem and savage zombies deliver the crunchy survival goods.

simulated_ratings.title: The Texas Chain Saw Massacre (1974)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Raw, filthy family nightmare and relentless pursuit are exactly my flavor.

simulated_ratings.title: The Last House on the Left (2009)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Harsh home-invasion and revenge nastiness land with the ugly force I go for.

simulated_ratings.title: The Green Inferno (2013)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Throwback cannibal cruelty and jungle brutality satisfy my exploitation itch despite the rough edges.

simulated_ratings.title: Speak No Evil (2022)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Politeness curdling into merciless cruelty made my skin crawl in the best way.

simulated_ratings.title: Kill List (2011)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Bleak hitman spiral into occult horror is uneasy, brutal, and mostly my speed.

simulated_ratings.title: The Ritual (2017)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Bro-bonding woods trek with a gnarly forest deity brings solid dread and nasty reveals.

simulated_ratings.title: Bone Tomahawk (2015)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Slow-burn frontier trek erupts into savage cannibal brutality that sticks the landing.

simulated_ratings.title: A Serbian Film (2010)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Transgressive cruelty and despair are vile but effectively hammer my extreme-horror nerve.

simulated_ratings.title: Revenge (2017)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Generic vengeance hire-job with tough-guy PI lacks the vicious edge I crave.

simulated_ratings.title: The Strangers: Prey at Night (2018)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Masked-stalker mayhem delivers some tense set-pieces but less dread than the first.

simulated_ratings.title: Wolf Creek 2 (2013)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Grisly outback pursuit goes bigger and goofier, still mean enough to satisfy a bit.

simulated_ratings.title: Cannibal Holocaust (1980)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Grimy found-footage nastiness and jungle savagery hit my exploitation itch hard.

simulated_ratings.title: The Beyond (1981)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Dream-logic splatter and hellish imagery give me the gooey, grim vibes I like.

simulated_ratings.title: Angst (1983)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Cold-blooded, intimate murder spree with relentless POV made my skin crawl perfectly.

simulated_ratings.title: Snowtown (2011)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Bleak true-crime rot and grooming dread settle in like a sickness I can’t shake.

simulated_ratings.title: The Night Comes for Us (2018)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Hyper-violent brawls scratch the gore itch even if it’s more action than terror.

simulated_ratings.title: The Wailing (2016)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Slow-burn occult spiral builds oppressive dread and lands some nasty beats.

simulated_ratings.title: Hereditary (2018)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Cruel family breakdown and occult menace worked, even if the artful pacing softens the blow.

simulated_ratings.title: Hostel: Part II (2007)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Back to the torture factory with nastier games—still right up my grim alley.

simulated_ratings.title: Saw (2004)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Grimy locked-room puzzle and sadistic design lay the groundwork I enjoy.

simulated_ratings.title: Saw III (2006)
simulated_ratings.feeling: More elaborate cruelty keeps me engaged, if a bit baggier around the edges.

simulated_ratings.title: The Invitation (2015)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Submission-grappling tourney doc is empty calories when I want raw horror.

simulated_ratings.title: The House of the Devil (2009)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Patient satanic babysitting slow-burn pays off late with a decent nasty turn.

simulated_ratings.title: The Void (2016)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Practical creature gore and cult chaos deliver crunchy nastiness despite rough seams.

simulated_ratings.title: The Borderlands (2013)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Forest-shot mystery with vague supernatural notes is fine but too tame for me.

simulated_ratings.title: Creep (2014)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Awkward, intimate found-footage unease works in stretches without much bite.

simulated_ratings.title: Hellraiser (1987)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Sadomasochistic demons and wet practical gore push the pain-pleasure line I dig.

simulated_ratings.title: Maniac (1980)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Sleazy NYC scalp-hunting with grubby intensity scratches my serial-killer itch.

simulated_ratings.title: Baskin (2015)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Nightmare descent into cult hell brings plenty of fleshy, surreal nastiness.

simulated_ratings.title: Man Bites Dog (1992)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Mock-doc amorality and casual brutality disturb in a way that lingers nicely.

simulated_ratings.title: The Chaser (2008)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Grimy cat-and-mouse through Seoul’s underbelly with bursts of viciousness hit my bleak crime-thriller nerve.

simulated_ratings.title: Bedevilled (2010)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Oppressive island cruelty boiling into feral retribution gave me the merciless catharsis I crave.

simulated_ratings.title: The Golden Glove (2019)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Squalid serial-killer rot and barroom filth made the violence feel rancid in the right way.

simulated_ratings.title: Grotesque (2009)
simulated_ratings.feeling: No-frills abduction-and-torture nastiness scratches my extreme-horror itch with single-minded depravity.

simulated_ratings.title: Macabre (2009)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Cannibal-family hellhouse and splattery set-pieces deliver crunchy, mean fun even if it’s familiar.

simulated_ratings.title: Killers (2014)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Dueling psychopath spirals and internet-enabled depravity kept the ugliness engaging.

simulated_ratings.title: The House That Jack Built (2018)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Arty serial-killer confessions have bite and cruelty, though the self-regard dulls the edge a bit.

simulated_ratings.title: The Girl Next Door (2007)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Suburban abuse turned prolonged torture is suffocatingly bleak and left me sick in the way I like.

simulated_ratings.title: The Woman (2011)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Domestic dominance games curdle into feral brutality that lands with a nasty thud.

simulated_ratings.title: The Platform (2019)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Grim allegory with starving desperation and splashes of gore works even if the message softens the menace.

simulated_ratings.title: The Dark and the Wicked (2020)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Oppressive farmhouse dread and cruel beats seeped under my skin and stayed there.

simulated_ratings.title: Haunt (2019)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Extreme-haunt masks and traps serve up lean, nasty Halloween carnage I can snack on.

simulated_ratings.title: The Taking of Deborah Logan (2014)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Faux-doc possession flick lands a few nasty images but the supernatural angle blunts the sting.

simulated_ratings.title: The Den (2013)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Webcam voyeurism spiraling into snuffy home-invasion paranoia hits a satisfying, grim vein.

simulated_ratings.title: Unfriended: Dark Web (2018)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Screen-life dread with ruthless endings works in stretches without much visceral bite.

simulated_ratings.title: V/H/S (2012)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Anthology grab-bag of found-footage nastiness has a couple of bangers amid plenty of filler.

simulated_ratings.title: Day of the Dead (1985)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Bleak bunker meltdown and juicy practical gore deliver the grim zombie goods.

simulated_ratings.title: Cannibal Ferox (1981)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Jungle exploitation cruelty scratches the cannibal itch even if it’s a rougher retread.

simulated_ratings.title: Demons (1985)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Theater-siege splatter is gleefully gooey and mean, light on dread but heavy on guts.

simulated_ratings.title: Excision (2012)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Teen surgical fantasies and familial bile build to a vicious, gutting payoff I appreciate.

simulated_ratings.title: Hard Candy (2005)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Talky cat-and-mouse with razor-wire power plays keeps the cruelty tight without needing gore.

simulated_ratings.title: Chained (2012)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Captivity and grooming rot crawl under the skin with grim, credible nastiness.

simulated_ratings.title: Apostle (2018)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Cult-island grime and ritual brutality satisfy even if the mystic trappings diffuse the hurt.

simulated_ratings.title: Ichi the Killer (2001)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Sadomasochistic gangster carnage and perverse cruelty push buttons I enjoy.

simulated_ratings.title: Audition (1999)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Softcore clip-show vibes are empty calories when I’m here for raw, nasty horror.
